Reviews.Title: Samsung 12.2MP Digital Camera - Red (SL600)  - a Definite Yes
Reviews.Author: Robert Wolf
Reviews.Content: It does much more than I expected.There are more programs available to accommodate most light and action settings. You can review the shots without having to turn the camera on.The battery last way longer than my Canon and those rechargeable AA's do.I'm purchasing a second one for work.

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: penmanship
Reviews.Content: We wanted a first camera as a gift for a creative 3rd grader. Cheap, so as to not burden her with owning something expensive, good enough not to cramp her style, red enough to go with a Hello Kitty camera case. That was the idea. Zoom, a plus, small size a must. Already the first outing was a nice surprise. The camera handled very difficult lighting, and did well compared with a much more up-market camera. Since then, the budding photographer has been every bit as daring as we had imagined and the camera has delivered all that we expected from such a compact package and then some. It's hard to see which "must-have" feature we would have gotten even for twice the price, and we're sure glad we resisted the tempation to buy one of those "kids' cameras".

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Stacy "Stacy"
Reviews.Content: Not expensive, but a great camera. I'm loving it! If you don't need all the newest camera with all the bells and whistles, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: mnspry
Reviews.Content: This camera worked for a little while. The quality of the pictures has never been great, but now the pictures are all fuzzy. Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: Becka Bruderer
Reviews.Content: This camera has a big black spot on the lens (i presume), it's on all the faces, and it cannot be removed.  I really think, instead of stating "in good condition. has minor wear from normal use.. 100% guaranteed against defects!" it should state exactly what is wrong with it.  I ordered this for a kid I work with who wanted to give it to his sister for xmas.  Now what?!  Very disappointed, and it makes me not trust anything that I may buy in the future, since people don't want to be truthful in their descriptions.

Reviews.Title: You Can Do Better
Reviews.Author: Alexandra B. Northard
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a birthday present in July 2010. By the second time I used it, some dead cell showed up on the LCD screen (annoying black dot that is dime-sized). I had not dropped it or done any other harm to it, so apparently the LCD screen is super sensitive. Also, I have had a hard time getting the camera to focus on objects/subjects and the pictures turn out poor quality, whereas using another camera for the same thing produces nice images. I do wonder if having the camera shipped to me from another state damaged it, though. Maybe I just got a previously damaged camera? The positive things I will say about this camera is that it is small and compact, is easy to use, and I like that is has video mode. It also came with a rechargeable battery and has a good long battery life. I love the large LCD, too.In the past I have had Canon, Sony, Fuji, and Kodak digital cameras and they all took better quality pictures than this camera.
